text.text_translated: In the last two hundred years, improvements in technology and health meant that fewer children died young. This led to rapid population growth. These large families then had even more children who lived long enough to become adults and have their own families. Contraception means using methods to stop a woman from having a baby. However, contraception became more available in the 1960s. After this, the average number of babies for each woman in the world fell from six to two.

best_attempt.text_translated: In the last two hundred years, improvements in technology and health meant that fewer children died young. This led to rapid population growth. These large families then had even more children who lived long enough to become adults and have their own families. Contraception means using methods to prevent pregnancy. In the 1960s, contraception became more widely available. As a result, the global average number of babies per woman has fallen from six to as low as two.
